summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutors discussing revisions to a proposed 'Epstein Sharing Order Part II.' The correspondence focuses on ensuring the order's language is broad enough to cover the sharing of trust and will documents (including a 'Trust Two') related to Jeffrey Epstein's estate with other parties, likely for investigative or legal purposes.

connections.description: M and other prosecutors are preparing a legal document (sharing order) for submission to CM, indicating a formal court proceeding.

events.title: Drafting of Epstein Sharing Order Part II
events.description: Prosecutors at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York exchange emails to draft, review, and finalize a court order ('Sharing Order Part II') to share trust and will documents from Jeffrey Epstein's estate.

keyFacts: Prosecutors were actively working in late January 2020 on a legal mechanism ('Sharing Order Part II') to distribute documents from Jeffrey Epstein's estate.
The documents in question include wills and trust documents, specifically referencing a 'Trust Two' and a '2019 Trust.'
There is internal discussion about whether 'Trust Two' documents were referenced in any will and whether revocations of documents should be included in the sharing order.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal proceedings and evidence sharing related to Epstein's estate following his death.
